Method Detail

oneway

public static Replicator oneway(Replication replication)

Creates a Replicator object set up to replicate changes in one direction between a local datastore and remote database.

Parameters:
replication - replication configuration information
Returns:
a Replicator instance which can be used to start and stop the replication itself.
See Also:
PushReplication, PullReplication

oneway

@Deprecated
public static Replicator oneway(Datastore source,
                                           java.net.URI target)
Deprecated. 

Creates a Replicator object set up to replicate changes from the local datastore to a remote database.

The target URI parameters used in the methods below must include:

   protocol://[username:password@]host[:port]/database_name

protocol, host and database_name are required. If no port is provided, the default for protocol is used. Using a database_name containing a / is not supported.

Parameters:
source - local Datastore to replicate changes from.
target - remote database to replicate changes to.
Returns:
a Replicator instance which can be used to start and stop the replication itself.

oneway

@Deprecated
public static Replicator oneway(java.net.URI source,
                                           Datastore target)
Deprecated. 

Creates a Replicator object set up to replicate changes from a remote database to the local datastore.

The source URI parameters used in the methods below must include:

   protocol://[username:password@]host[:port]/database_name

protocol, host and database_name are required. If no port is provided, the default for protocol is used. Using a database_name containing a / is not supported.

Parameters:
source - remote database to replicate changes from.
target - local Datastore to replicate changes to.
Returns:
a Replicator instance which can be used to start and stop the replication itself.
